title: Scope
summary: Article 2 defines the material, personal, and territorial scope of the EU Artificial Intelligence Act. It specifies that the Regulation applies to providers, deployers, importers, distributors, manufacturers, authorised representatives, and affected persons when AI systems or general-purpose AI models are placed on the market, put into service, or used in the Union, including in certain extra-territorial situations. The Article sets out important exclusions, including for national security, military and defence uses, certain international cooperation contexts, purely scientific research and development, and personal non-professional use. It also clarifies the relationship of the Act with other EU rules on data protection, intermediary liability, consumer protection, product safety, and workersâ€™ rights. Finally, it states that open-source AI is generally excluded unless it is placed on the market as a high-risk system or one falling under specific prohibitions or transparency rules.
